file_summary: This HTML file, `owners.html`, serves as a Thymeleaf template responsible for displaying a paginated list of veterinary clinic owners. It integrates with a `fragments/layout.html` to maintain a consistent page layout. The main purpose of this page is to present essential information for each owner, including their name, address, city, telephone number, and a list of their pets, in a tabular format. It includes dynamic links to view individual owner details (`/owners/{id}`). Furthermore, the template incorporates pagination controls, allowing users to navigate through large datasets of owners by displaying the total number of pages and providing links to the first, previous, next, and last pages, based on the current page. The content is internationalized using Thymeleaf's message expressions (e.g., `#{owners}`, `#{name}`).

attributes.name: listOwners
attributes.description: A list of owner objects to be displayed in the table. Each Owner object is expected to have properties like id, firstName, lastName, address, city, telephone, and pets.

attributes.name: totalPages
attributes.description: The total number of pages available for owner records, used for pagination controls.

attributes.name: currentPage
attributes.description: The current page number being viewed, used to highlight the current page and control pagination links.

functions.name: Thymeleaf Template Rendering Logic
functions.description: This is an HTML template and does not contain traditional programming functions. Instead, it uses Thymeleaf expressions for dynamic content rendering, iteration (`th:each`), conditional rendering (`th:if`, `th:unless`), data binding (`th:text`, `th:href`), and internationalization (`#{key}`). Specific logic includes iterating over `listOwners`, joining pet names using `#strings.listJoin`, and generating pagination links based on `currentPage` and `totalPages`.
